medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports onset of lower abdominal pain that began last ___ and has been progressively worsening. The pain is located specifically in the suprapubic region and worse in the left lower quadrant. Associated symptoms include fevers up to 101Â°F, chills, nausea, and anorexia. She has experienced increasing abdominal distension with no bowel movement or flatus since the pain started, and also has difficulty urinating due to pain with some burning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension (HTN), type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), hyperlipidemia (HLD), hypothyroidism, moderate mitral regurgitation (MR), mild aortic regurgitation (AR), left breast ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), open appendectomy, left partial mastectomy.
medical_history.family_history: No known family history of colon cancer.
